criteria: Accuracy and breadth of emotion description
Clarity and detail in describing emotional responses and triggers
Use of appropriate vocabulary related to emotions
descriptions: The student does not attempt to describe any emotions.
The student attempts to describe emotions, but descriptions are inaccurate or irrelevant.
The student describes a very limited range of emotions with basic accuracy.
The student describes a moderate range of emotions with reasonable accuracy.
The student describes a broad range of emotions accurately, including some nuanced feelings.
The student comprehensively describes a wide variety of emotions with precision and insight, demonstrating a strong understanding of emotional complexity.
The student provides no information about emotional responses or triggers.
The student's descriptions of emotional responses or triggers are vague and unclear.
The student identifies some basic emotional responses or triggers, but lacks detail.
The student describes emotional responses and triggers with some clarity and detail.
The student provides clear and detailed descriptions of emotional responses and triggers, demonstrating a good understanding of how emotions are elicited.

The student provides exceptionally clear, detailed, and insightful descriptions of emotional responses and triggers, demonstrating a sophisticated understanding of the interplay between situations and emotions.
The student uses inappropriate or no vocabulary related to emotions.
The student uses very limited and basic vocabulary related to emotions.
The student uses some appropriate vocabulary related to emotions, but lacks precision.
The student uses a range of appropriate vocabulary related to emotions with reasonable accuracy.
The student uses a rich and varied vocabulary to describe emotions with precision.
The student uses sophisticated and nuanced vocabulary related to emotions, demonstrating mastery of emotional language.
